definition: to collude to fabricate a story

to string together/to skewer/to connect wrongly/to gang up/to rove/string/bunch/skewer/classifier for things that are strung together, or in a bunch, or in a row: string of, bunch of, series of/to make a swift or abrupt linear movement (like a bead on an abacus)/to move across

sentences.english: Detaining suspects to prevent collusion or the destruction of evidence is also plagued with problems.
sentences.chinese: 串供或滅證羈押的制度也不大有問題。

sentences.english: Some important information could be disclosed because of crossed wires.
sentences.chinese: 串供會使我們的一些重要資訊洩露。

definition: to retract testimony/to withdraw a confession
oral confession (as opposed to 筆供|笔供[bi3 gong4])/statement/deposition
to commit sb for trial/to bring sb for interrogation
to bend the law in order to favor one's relatives or associates (idiom)
lack of discipline/to break a rule/to violate discipline/to breach a principle
